title: PISCES - Biomonitoring Solutions
text:
Environmental DNA (eDNA) metabarcoding is a revolutionary approach to biodiversity monitoring. By analyzing DNA fragments found in environmental samples such as water, soil, and sediment, we can identify species present in an ecosystem without the need for direct observation or capture.



Biodiversity Assessment: Identify species in terrestrial, aquatic, and marine environments.
Impact Monitoring: Monitor the effects of environmental changes, pollution, and habitat destruction.
Conservation Planning: Inform conservation strategies by assessing species presence and population dynamics.
Invasive Species Detection: Early detection of invasive species to prevent ecological damage.

Our technology provides accurate, reliable, and non-invasive monitoring, making it a valuable tool for environmental management and conservation efforts.

title: PISCES - Soluções de Biomonitoramento
text:
PISCES - Soluções de Biomonitoramento
Welcome to PISCES, where we specialize in biomonitoring vertebrate and invertebrate communities in impacted ecosystems. Our solutions use cutting-edge eDNA metabarcoding technology to assess and monitor biodiversity with precision and efficiency.
Navigate through our website to learn more about our services, view our portfolio of past projects, and meet our dedicated team of experts.

title: PISCES - Biomonitoring Solutions
text:
Explore some of the impactful projects we’ve conducted in various ecosystems. These examples demonstrate our expertise and the value of our eDNA metabarcoding services.



Location: Gulf Coast Wetlands
Objective: Assessing the impact of agricultural runoff on aquatic biodiversity.
Outcome: Identified significant shifts in species composition, leading to improved water management practices.





Location: Great Lakes Region
Objective: Early detection of invasive species to prevent ecosystem disruption.
Outcome: Detected invasive zebra mussels at an early stage, enabling prompt mitigation measures.





Location: Urban Parklands, City X
Objective: Evaluating the effectiveness of urban rewilding initiatives.
Outcome: Documented increased biodiversity, supporting the continuation of rewilding projects.

title: PISCES - Biomonitoring Solutions
text:
Position: Senior Biologist
Expertise: Vertebrate Ecology, Conservation Biology
Background: Dr. Riverstone has over 15 years of experience in conservation biology, with a focus on vertebrate species in both terrestrial and aquatic environments. His work has been pivotal in developing eDNA techniques for monitoring endangered species.



Position: Invertebrate Specialist
Expertise: Invertebrate Ecology, Biodiversity Monitoring
Background: Dr. Waverly’s research focuses on the use of eDNA for invertebrate monitoring. She has worked extensively on projects assessing the impact of environmental change on invertebrate communities.



Position: Environmental DNA Analyst
Expertise: Molecular Ecology, eDNA Metabarcoding
Background: Dr. Lakewood is an expert in eDNA metabarcoding and has developed novel methods for analyzing complex environmental samples. Their work has significantly advanced the field of molecular ecology.
